publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 70.7

language.ana: frg:ls-cetom-archaic frg:ls-peyrot-A1 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-malzahn-A2 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-tamai-A1 frg:ls-C14

seg.seg: If they do not find [lit. obtain] any good instructing teacher, then they cannot do good for themselves and for others.
If they do not find [lit. obtain] any good instructing teacher, then they cannot do good for themselves and for others. (restoration after 165)
... lotus from fire, fire from water ...
For in countless numbers we miserable ones have made you our refuge [and] we abandoned our father and mother for you ...,
but you quickly went away to the nirvāṇa city [and] you left us as food to the kleśa enemies.
I (honour) you in [your] beauty and form. "It will arise then", thus is my hope. For we are very evil here
and of little glory; you turn towards us miserable ones, [but] you don’t speak to us. If another omniscient [Buddha] had arisen within a hundred years,

If another omniscient [Buddha] had arisen within a hundred years, then there [would have been] great need and want, because if there [had been] great need comparable to [the rareness of] the (udumbara)-flower, then you would not have been extinguished [so] quickly, would you?
then there [would have been] great need and want, because if there [had been] great need comparable to [the rareness of] the (udumbara)-
flower, then you would not have been extinguished [so] quickly, would you?

list.item: a2 If they do not find [lit. obtain] any good instructing teacher, then they cannot do good for themselves and for others. a3 ... lotus from fire, fire from water ... a5 For in countless numbers we miserable ones have made you our refuge [and] we abandoned our father and mother for you ..., b1 but you quickly went away to the nirvāṇa city [and] you left us as food to the kleśa enemies. b2 I (honour) you in [your] beauty and form. "It will arise then", thus is my hope. For we are very evil here b3 and of little glory; you turn towards us miserable ones, [but] you don’t speak to us. If another omniscient [Buddha] had arisen within a hundred years, b4 then there [would have been] great need and want, because if there [had been] great need comparable to [the rareness of] the (udumbara)- b5 flower, then you would not have been extinguished [so] quickly, would you?

a2-3 If they do not find [lit. obtain] any good instructing teacher, then they cannot do good for themselves and for others. (restoration after [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 165) 700
a5-b3 whose deliverance is thought of? 368
b3-5 If another omniscient [Buddha] had arisen within a hundred years, then there [would have been] great need and want, because if there [had been] great need comparable to [the rareness of] the (udumbara)-flower, then you would not have been extinguished [so] quickly, would you? 338


additional classification A1

a1 nts[e] ce_u _t_añ yäkne mā no ākeṃ 20-5 wrocceṃ yśelmeṃ ri_n_askent_r_a _m_an_t_ak āllyai_k\ /// a2 maistsi rām no _p_aknāskent_r_a e_n_aṣṣeñcai krent _k_aṣṣīn no ma kca _k_allaṃ ot mā cämpeṃ _ṣ_a[ñ](·) /// a3 rttse yāmtsi 20-6 tkā rā ○ no twe pwārmeṃ padu_m\ wärmeṃ pwār rā māka yolon preke /// a4 _t_s_aṅkāstā kreṃt prekeṣṣeṃ _t_s_aṅko_ṣ_aṃ ceṃ pūdñäkteṃnpā krente_unāsa ṣemaikne nes_t\ ñä[kt]e /// a5 snai keś w[ā] we_s\ cī [s]aim yāmoṣ tallāñciś[k]aṃ pā_t_ar mā_t_ar rīntsāmte pes[_t\] ciṣ[c](·)īkā /// b1 no twe rīne _r_ame(·) n(·)r[v]vānṣai pes_t\ o_r_asta we_s\ kle_ś_anmāṣṣeṃ sā_n_ants\ śwātsi 20-8 /// b2 cä erepāte tsātsaikarnne tsāṅkaṃ nno =ntwe te _m_ant _p_ar_m_aṅk\ _m_aske_t_ar ñī wes wā tnai /// b3 ñ mākā yekte-perni yu○st-me wā nnai tallāñciśkaṃ mā west-me_śca 20-9 _k_ante [p]i /// b4 piṅkte _t_s_aṅkālle ṣe_i allek poyśī ot rā mākā sne_ukī ynāñ_m_a k_uce _ṣ_ap no [k]ī /// b5 pyāppyaisa _ṣ_a_p\ māka sne_ukī māpi _r_ar kselle ṣai_t_a 30 epe wat no te [_m_a] ///
